alert.note: Alert for Laurens; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 9:53PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Central and southern Spartanburg County and northern Laurens County, South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to drainages and streams, including parks, greenways and trails, golf courses, boat-access areas, farmland, and woodlands. Nuisance flooding of poor-drainage areas, including underpasses and intersections, is also expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM EDT, Storm-total rainfall of 2-4 inches has occurred since Thursday morning, causing excessive runoff and significant rises along area drainages and streams this evening. Some streams and associated tributaries may exceed bankfull conditions over the next few hours, including Lawsons Fork Creek and Fairforest Creek near Spartanburg, and the North, Middle, and South Tyger rivers near Roebuck, Reidville, Lyman, and Duncan, flooding adjacent low-lying areas with shallow inundation. Additionally, common flood- prone areas in the Spartanburg metro, including railroad underpasses, may experience ponding and brief closure. Lawsons Fork Creek near Lake Forest Drive is rising steadily and is expected to exceed the Action/Advisory Stage of 12 feet by 11pm. The creek will continue to rise into the early overnight hours and may approach 14 feet before cresting and starting to recede early Friday morning. Nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying woodland areas is expected between US 221 and Goldmine Rd at these levels, as well as the Edwin Griffin Nature Preserve and The Country Club of Spartanburg. - Another round of heavy rainfall is impacting metro Spartanburg as of 10pm, producing another half inch of rain over a short period of time. This is likely to trigger areas of additional nuisance flooding and will exacerbate ongoing stream rises, prolonging high flows into the early overnight hours. Additional pockets of heavy rainfall are possible for at least through midnight, and this may further prolong ongoing flooding and cause new localized flooding to develop. Stay weather aware tonight if traveling on area roadways and turn around when encountering flooded roadways. - Some locations that may experience nuisance flooding include... Spartanburg, Laurens, Greer, Woodruff, Duncan, Lyman, Pacolet, Cowpens, Wellford, Roebuck, Gray Court, Pacolet Mills, Reidville, Moore, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs, Enoree, and Ora.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
